column1:
6.6.1	
General guidelines recommendations for the treatment of prostate cancer

column2:
Offer WW to patients with a life expectancy < 10 years.
Strong

Manage patients with a life expectancy > 10 years and low-risk 
Strong
disease by AS.

Patients with intraductal histology on biopsy should be excluded from 
AS.

Perform magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) before a confirmatory 
biopsy if no MRI has been performed before the initial biopsy.

Take both targeted biopsy (of any PI-RADS > 3 lesion) and systematic 
biopsy if a confirmatory biopsy is performed.

If MRI is not available, per-protocol confirmatory prostate biopsies 
should be performed.

If a patient has had upfront MRI followed by systematic and targeted 
biopsies there is no need for confirmatory biopsies.
